Package parsing.syntaxTree.exceptions

Interface ExceptionCheckProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassContent, ClassDeclaration, UcdFileReader, UcdParser

    public interface ExceptionCheckProvider
    Provides default methods for checking different types of possible error while parsing the ucd file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default void checkClassContent​(java.lang.String classContent)
      Makes sure that class declaration contains OPERATION and ATTRIBUTES
      default void checkIllegalChar​(java.lang.String txt)
      Makes sure the text does not contains illegal characters
      default void checkNoDuplicateTag​(java.lang.String txt, java.lang.String tag)  
      default void checkTagEqual​(java.lang.String txt, java.lang.String delim)
      Verify that a specified tag is actually at the beginning of the text.
      default void checkTagPresent​(java.lang.String txt, java.lang.String tag)
      Makes sure that a specified text is within another text.
      default void checkValidAggregations​(java.lang.String txt)  
      default void checkValidDataItem​(java.lang.String txt)  
      default void checkValidOperation​(java.lang.String txt)  
      default void checkValidRole​(java.lang.String txt)  
      default void checkValidSubclasses​(java.lang.String txt)  
      default void checkValidType​(java.lang.String content)  
      default void malformed​()

      • checkTagPresent

        default void checkTagPresent​(java.lang.String txt,
                             java.lang.String tag)
        Makes sure that a specified text is within another text. Basically a wrapper around String.contains(CharSequence) that can throw an exception if it is not contained
        Parameters:
        txt - the text to analyze
        tag - the text to check if it is contained or not
